alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 14 at 5:31AM AKDT until October 16 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations up to a quarter of an inch possible. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel could be hazardous. Power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A storm system will bring another round of heavy precipitation to the Copper River Basin for Saturday. This system will usher in warm air aloft that will ride overtop the cold air in place near the surface. This will mean that any snow that does develop Saturday morning could change to a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain. As temperatures continue to warm aloft Saturday afternoon, the precipitation is expected to become mainly freezing rain, especially from the junction of the Richardson and Edgerton Highways north. Temperatures will slowly warm above freezing from south to north through the latter half of Saturday, with most locations changing to all rain by Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
